questions.question: What percentage of a cat's life is spent sleeping?
questions.explanation: Cats sleep 12-16 hours per day, which is about 70% of their lives! This helps them conserve energy for hunting.

questions.question: How many bones does an adult human body have?
questions.explanation: An adult human has 206 bones. Babies are born with about 270 bones, but many fuse together as they grow.

questions.question: What color is the sunset on Mars?
questions.explanation: Sunsets on Mars appear blue! This is because the Martian atmosphere scatters blue light differently than Earth's atmosphere.

questions.question: Which animal has the largest brain relative to its body size?
questions.explanation: Ants have the largest brain-to-body ratio! Their brains make up about 15% of their body weight.

questions.question: How fast does your heart beat per minute when resting?
questions.explanation: A healthy adult's heart beats 60-80 times per minute at rest, pumping about 5 liters of blood through your body!

questions.question: How long would it take to drive to the Moon at highway speeds?
questions.explanation: If you could drive to the Moon at 60 mph non-stop, it would take about 6 months! The Moon is 238,855 miles away.

questions.question: What special ability do cats have that humans don't?
questions.explanation: Cats can hear frequencies up to 64,000 Hz (humans only hear up to 20,000 Hz). This helps them hunt small prey like mice!

questions.question: Which part of your body continues to grow throughout your entire life?
questions.explanation: Your ears (and nose) never stop growing! The cartilage continues to grow throughout your life, though very slowly.

questions.question: What happens to your body in space without a spacesuit?
questions.explanation: You'd pass out in about 15 seconds due to lack of oxygen. You wouldn't explode or freeze instantly like in movies!

questions.question: Why do cats purr?
questions.explanation: Cats purr when happy, to communicate, and amazingly, the vibrations may help heal their bones and muscles!

questions.question: What's the strongest muscle in your body?
questions.explanation: Your jaw muscle (masseter) can exert up to 200 pounds of force! That's why you can bite through tough foods.

questions.question: How many Earths could fit inside the Sun?
questions.explanation: About 1.3 million Earths could fit inside the Sun! The Sun contains 99.86% of all the mass in our solar system.

questions.question: Which ocean animal is known to use tools?
questions.explanation: Octopuses are incredibly smart! They use coconut shells as portable shelters and rocks to crack open shellfish.

questions.question: How much of your brain do you actually use?
questions.explanation: You use nearly 100% of your brain! The '10%' myth has been completely debunked by modern neuroscience.

questions.question: What's the hottest planet in our solar system?
questions.explanation: Venus is the hottest at 900°F (480°C) due to its thick atmosphere that traps heat, even though Mercury is closer to the Sun!

questions.question: How do cats always land on their feet?
questions.explanation: Cats have a 'righting reflex' that lets them twist their flexible spine mid-air to land feet-first in just 1-2 seconds!

questions.question: What happens to your height in space?
questions.explanation: You grow about 2 inches taller in space! Without gravity, your spine stretches out and decompresses.

questions.question: Which animal can see the most colors?
questions.explanation: Mantis shrimp can see 16 types of color receptors (humans have 3)! They can see colors we can't even imagine.

questions.question: Why do you get goosebumps?
questions.explanation: Tiny muscles around hair follicles contract when you're cold, scared, or emotionally moved - it's an ancient survival reflex!

questions.question: How do cats show affection by blinking?
questions.explanation: Slow blinking is a 'cat kiss'! When cats slowly blink at you, they're showing trust and affection.

questions.question: What's the closest star to Earth (besides the Sun)?
questions.explanation: Proxima Centauri (part of the Alpha Centauri system) is 4.24 light-years away - the closest star to our Sun!

questions.question: Why can't you tickle yourself?
questions.explanation: Your brain predicts your own movements, so it cancels out the tickling sensation. You need the element of surprise!

questions.question: Which bird is the smartest?
questions.explanation: Crows are incredibly smart! They use tools, remember human faces, and can solve complex puzzles. Some are smarter than young children!

questions.question: Why don't cats like water?
questions.explanation: Most cats dislike water because their fur becomes heavy and takes a long time to dry, making them feel vulnerable.

questions.question: What would happen if you cried in space?
questions.explanation: In zero gravity, tears don't fall! They form a bubble around your eyes until you wipe them away.

questions.question: How many taste buds do you have?
questions.explanation: You have about 10,000 taste buds! They regenerate every 1-2 weeks, which is why your taste can change over time.

questions.question: Which sea creature has three hearts?
questions.explanation: Octopuses have three hearts! Two pump blood to their gills, and one pumps blood to the rest of their body.

questions.question: Do cats have a dominant paw like humans?
questions.explanation: Just like humans, cats can be left or right-pawed! Female cats tend to be right-pawed, males tend to be left-pawed.

questions.question: How many times does your heart beat in a lifetime?
questions.explanation: Your heart beats about 3 billion times in an average lifetime! It's the hardest-working muscle in your body.

questions.question: What's the largest volcano in our solar system?
questions.explanation: Olympus Mons on Mars is 13.6 miles tall - nearly 3 times taller than Mount Everest! It's the size of Arizona.

questions.question: How many trees would you need to make just one sheet of paper?
questions.explanation: It takes about 1/17,000th of a tree to make one sheet of paper! One tree can produce roughly 17,000 sheets of paper.

questions.question: What happens if you fold a piece of paper 42 times?
questions.explanation: If you could fold paper 42 times, it would be thick enough to reach from Earth to the Moon! Each fold doubles the thickness exponentially.

questions.question: How much does a cloud weigh?
questions.explanation: An average cumulus cloud weighs about 1 million pounds! The water droplets are so tiny they float on air currents.

questions.question: What color is your blood inside your body?
questions.explanation: Your blood is always dark red inside your body! Veins look blue through your skin due to how light scatters, not because blood is blue.

questions.question: How fast does lightning travel?
questions.explanation: Lightning travels at about 1/3 the speed of light - roughly 62,000 miles per second! That's fast enough to circle Earth 2.5 times in one second.

questions.question: What animal can survive in the vacuum of space?
questions.explanation: Tardigrades (water bears) can survive in space! They can withstand extreme temperatures, radiation, and even the vacuum of space for up to 30 years.

questions.question: How long is your DNA if stretched out?
questions.explanation: All the DNA in your body, if stretched out, would reach about 10 billion miles - from Earth to Pluto and back!

questions.question: What percentage of your DNA do you share with bananas?
questions.explanation: Humans share about 50% of their DNA with bananas! We share 60% with fruit flies and 96% with chimpanzees.

questions.question: How many atoms are in a single drop of water?
questions.explanation: One drop of water contains about 5 sextillion atoms (5,000,000,000,000,000,000,000)! That's more than all the stars in the observable universe.

questions.question: What happens to your height on the International Space Station?
questions.explanation: Astronauts grow about 2 inches taller in space! Without gravity compressing their spine, the discs between vertebrae expand.

questions.question: How many times does a hummingbird's heart beat per minute?
questions.explanation: A hummingbird's heart beats up to 1,200 times per minute! That's 20 times per second to power their incredibly fast wing beats.

questions.question: What animal has blue blood?
questions.explanation: Octopuses have blue blood! They use copper-based hemocyanin instead of iron-based hemoglobin to carry oxygen.

questions.question: How much force does it take to bite through your own finger?
questions.explanation: It takes about the same force to bite through your finger as a carrot! Your brain just stops you from doing it (thankfully).

questions.question: What's inside the core of most golf balls?
questions.explanation: Many golf balls have honey in their core! The honey provides perfect weight distribution and bounce characteristics.

questions.question: How long would it take to count to a billion?
questions.explanation: If you counted non-stop, one number per second, it would take about 32 years to count to one billion!

questions.question: What animal sleeps standing up?
questions.explanation: Giraffes, elephants, and horses can all sleep standing up! They have special leg-locking mechanisms to prevent falling over.

questions.question: How fast do your fingernails grow?
questions.explanation: Your fingernails grow about 3mm per month - roughly the thickness of a coin! Toenails grow about 4 times slower.

questions.question: What natural phenomenon can reach 50,000°F?
questions.explanation: Lightning can reach 50,000°F - that's 5 times hotter than the surface of the Sun! It's the hottest natural thing on Earth.

questions.question: How many species of insects exist on Earth?
questions.explanation: Scientists estimate there are 10 million insect species on Earth! That's more than all other animal species combined.

questions.question: What happens to your voice in helium because...?
questions.explanation: Sound travels 3 times faster through helium than air! This makes the resonant frequency of your vocal tract higher, creating that squeaky voice.

questions.question: How many human cells does the average person lose per day?
questions.explanation: You lose about 30 billion cells every day! But don't worry - your body makes 25 million new cells every second to replace them.

questions.question: What color is the 'black box' on airplanes?
questions.explanation: Aircraft 'black boxes' are actually bright orange! This makes them easier to find after a crash. The name comes from early electronic recording devices.

questions.question: How much of an iceberg is underwater?
questions.explanation: About 90% of an iceberg is underwater! This is where the phrase 'tip of the iceberg' comes from - you only see the small part above water.

questions.question: What animal can regrow its entire brain?
questions.explanation: Flatworms can regrow their entire brain in just 2 weeks! Cut one in half and both pieces will grow into complete worms with full memories.

questions.question: What happens if you put honey in a time capsule for 1000 years?
questions.explanation: Honey never spoils! Archaeologists have found 3,000-year-old honey in Egyptian tombs that's still perfectly edible.

questions.question: How many thoughts does the average person have per day?
questions.explanation: The average person has about 50,000 thoughts per day! That's roughly one thought every 1.2 seconds during waking hours.

questions.question: What animal can live for over 400 years?
questions.explanation: Greenland sharks can live over 400 years! The oldest one found was estimated to be 512 years old - it was alive during Shakespeare's time!

questions.question: How fast do radio waves travel through space?
questions.explanation: Radio waves travel at the speed of light - 186,000 miles per second! A radio signal from Earth reaches the Moon in 1.3 seconds.

questions.question: What percentage of the ocean have humans explored?
questions.explanation: Humans have explored less than 5% of the ocean! We know more about the surface of Mars than the bottom of our own oceans.

questions.question: How many muscles does it take to frown vs smile?
questions.explanation: Both smiling and frowning use about the same number of muscles (10-12)! The 'it takes more muscles to frown' saying is actually a myth.

questions.question: What animal's tongue can be as long as its body?
questions.explanation: A chameleon's tongue can be 1.5-2 times its body length! It shoots out in 1/100th of a second to catch insects.

questions.question: How many dimples are on a golf ball?
questions.explanation: Golf balls have 300-500 dimples! The dimples create turbulence that helps the ball fly farther and more accurately.

questions.question: What happens to diamonds under extreme pressure?
questions.explanation: Under extreme pressure and heat, diamonds turn back into graphite (pencil lead)! They're actually just carbon arranged differently.

questions.question: How long does it take a photon to travel from the Sun's core to surface?
questions.explanation: It takes about 100,000 years for light to travel from the Sun's core to its surface! But only 8 minutes to reach Earth from there.

questions.question: What animal has the strongest bite force?
questions.explanation: Saltwater crocodiles have the strongest bite force at 3,700 pounds per square inch! That's enough to crush a small car.

questions.question: How much saliva do you produce in a lifetime?
questions.explanation: You produce about 25,000 gallons of saliva in a lifetime! That's enough to fill two swimming pools.

questions.question: What color are zebra stripes when they're born?
questions.explanation: Baby zebras are born with brown and white stripes! The brown darkens to black as they grow older.

questions.question: How many bones do sharks have?
questions.explanation: Sharks have zero bones! Their skeletons are made entirely of cartilage, which is why shark fossils are so rare.

questions.question: What happens to your sense of taste in space?
questions.explanation: Your sense of taste gets much weaker in space! Fluids shift in your body, causing a stuffy-nose effect that dulls taste buds.

questions.question: How many times can you fold paper before it becomes impossible?
questions.explanation: You can only fold paper about 7 times! The thickness doubles with each fold, making it impossible to continue without enormous force.

questions.question: What animal can change its gender?
questions.explanation: Clownfish, some frogs, and many other animals can change gender! This helps them adapt to environmental conditions and reproduce.

questions.question: How much does your brain shrink when you're dehydrated by just 2%?
questions.explanation: Just 2% dehydration makes your brain noticeably shrink and work much less efficiently! This is why you feel foggy when dehydrated.

questions.question: What animal has fingerprints almost identical to humans?
questions.explanation: Koalas have fingerprints so similar to humans that they could confuse crime scene investigators! Even under a microscope they look almost identical.

questions.question: How many times faster than sound is the crack of a whip?
questions.explanation: The crack of a whip is actually a tiny sonic boom! The tip moves faster than sound, creating that sharp cracking noise.

questions.question: What percentage of your body is stardust?
questions.explanation: About 97% of your body mass is stardust! The carbon, oxygen, and other heavy elements were forged inside ancient stars that exploded billions of years ago.

questions.question: How many sides does a snowflake always have?
questions.explanation: Snowflakes always have 6 sides! This is because of the hexagonal crystal structure of ice, determined by how water molecules bond together.

questions.question: What animal can survive being frozen solid?
questions.explanation: Wood frogs can freeze completely solid in winter and come back to life in spring! They produce natural antifreeze to protect their organs.

questions.question: How much stronger is spider silk than steel?
questions.explanation: Spider silk is 5 times stronger than steel by weight! If spider silk were as thick as steel cable, it could stop a fighter jet.

questions.question: What happens to your height throughout the day?
questions.explanation: You're about 1 inch shorter at night than in the morning! Gravity compresses your spine during the day, and it decompresses while you sleep.

questions.question: How many Earth days is one day on Venus?
questions.explanation: One day on Venus lasts 243 Earth days! Ironically, a Venus day is longer than a Venus year (225 Earth days).

questions.question: What animal has the best memory?
questions.explanation: Elephants have incredible memories! They can remember other elephants they haven't seen for decades and return to water sources from 30+ years ago.

questions.question: How many times does your eye blink per day?
questions.explanation: You blink about 15,000-20,000 times per day! That's roughly once every 2-3 seconds to keep your eyes moist and clean.

questions.question: What natural substance is harder than diamond?
questions.explanation: Lonsdaleite, formed when meteorites hit Earth, is 58% harder than diamond! It's incredibly rare and forms under extreme pressure.

questions.question: How fast can a sneeze travel?
questions.explanation: A sneeze can travel up to 160 mph! The droplets can travel up to 26 feet, which is why covering your mouth is so important.

questions.question: What animal can see with its tongue?
questions.explanation: Butterflies taste with their feet and 'see' with their tongues! They have chemoreceptors that detect flower chemicals to find nectar.

questions.question: How much does the Internet weigh?
questions.explanation: The entire Internet weighs about 2 ounces! This is the combined weight of all the electrons moving through servers and cables worldwide.

questions.question: What happens to time at the top of skyscrapers?
questions.explanation: Time moves slightly faster at the top of skyscrapers! Due to Einstein's relativity, weaker gravity makes time run faster by nanoseconds.

questions.question: How many species become extinct every day?
questions.explanation: Scientists estimate 100-1,000 species go extinct every day! This is 100-1,000 times the natural background extinction rate.

questions.question: What color is a giraffe's tongue?
questions.explanation: Giraffes have dark purple tongues! The dark color protects them from sunburn since they stick their 18-inch tongues out all day to eat leaves.

questions.question: How much of your lifetime do you spend dreaming?
questions.explanation: You spend about 6 years of your lifetime dreaming! That's roughly 2 hours per night during REM sleep over an average lifespan.

questions.question: What happens to your stomach when you blush?
questions.explanation: Your stomach lining also blushes when you do! The same capillary dilation that makes your face red happens in your stomach too.

questions.question: How many cells in your body are actually human?
questions.explanation: Only 43% of your body's cells are actually human! The rest are bacteria, viruses, fungi, and other microorganisms that live in and on you.

questions.question: What animal produces square poop?
questions.explanation: Wombats produce cube-shaped poop! Their intestines have varying elasticity that shapes the waste into cubes, which don't roll away on slopes.

questions.question: How long does it take for your body to completely replace all its atoms?
questions.explanation: Every 7 years, nearly every atom in your body is replaced! You're literally not the same person you were 7 years ago, atomically speaking.

questions.question: What's the most abundant element in the universe?
questions.explanation: Hydrogen makes up about 75% of the universe's normal matter! It's the simplest element with just one proton and one electron.

questions.question: How many muscles does an elephant's trunk have?
questions.explanation: An elephant's trunk has over 40,000 muscles! That's more than in an entire human body, giving them incredible precision and strength.

questions.question: What happens to your brain when you learn something new?
questions.explanation: Learning creates new neural connections and can even grow new brain cells! Your brain physically changes and rewires itself throughout your entire life.

questions.question: How much gold is dissolved in the world's oceans?
questions.explanation: There are about 20 million tons of gold dissolved in seawater! If we could extract it all, every person on Earth would get about 9 pounds of gold.

questions.question: What animal can regrow its head?
questions.explanation: Hydras can regrow their entire head in 3 days! Cut off their head and it grows back completely, including a new brain and mouth.

questions.question: How many possible games of chess exist?
questions.explanation: There are more possible chess games than atoms in the observable universe! The number is roughly 10^120 - an incomprehensibly large number.

questions.question: What percentage of your brain is water?
questions.explanation: Your brain is about 75% water! Even 2% dehydration can significantly affect your memory, mood, and concentration.

questions.question: What animal has teeth that never stop growing?
questions.explanation: Sharks, beavers, and elephants all have teeth that never stop growing! They need constant growth to replace worn teeth from their diets.

questions.question: How hot is lightning compared to the Sun's surface?
questions.explanation: Lightning is about 5 times hotter than the Sun's surface! Lightning reaches 50,000°F while the Sun's surface is only 10,000°F.

questions.question: What happens if you cry in space?
questions.explanation: In space, tears don't fall - they form a bubble around your eye! Without gravity, the tears just stick to your face until you wipe them away.

questions.question: How many heartbeats do you have left if you're 20 years old?
questions.explanation: If you're 20, you have roughly 2 billion heartbeats left! Your heart beats about 100,000 times per day for an average lifespan.

questions.question: What animal has the most powerful bite relative to its size?
questions.explanation: The Tasmanian devil has the strongest bite relative to body size! It can bite with the force of a large dog despite being the size of a small one.

questions.question: How many times can a piece of paper be recycled?
questions.explanation: Paper can only be recycled 5-7 times! Each time, the fibers get shorter and weaker until they can't bond together anymore.

questions.question: How much does a cumulus cloud weigh?
questions.explanation: An average cumulus cloud weighs about 1.1 million pounds! That's equivalent to about 100 elephants floating in the sky.

questions.question: What percentage of your DNA is identical to everyone else's?
questions.explanation: You share 99.9% of your DNA with every other human! Only 0.1% makes you genetically unique, which is still about 3 million differences.

questions.question: How many gallons of blood does your heart pump per day?
questions.explanation: Your heart pumps about 2,000 gallons of blood every day! That's enough to fill a small swimming pool or wash 80 loads of laundry.

questions.question: What animal can change the color of its fur in winter?
questions.explanation: Arctic foxes, arctic hares, and some other animals change from brown to white fur in winter! This helps them blend in with snow for camouflage.

questions.question: How long does it take for light from distant stars to reach Earth?
questions.explanation: Light from distant stars takes years to millions of years to reach us! When you look at stars, you're literally seeing them as they were in the past.

questions.question: What happens to your voice box during puberty?
questions.explanation: Your voice box (larynx) doubles in size during puberty! This is why voices crack and change - especially dramatically in boys.

questions.question: How many times stronger is a eagle's vision than human vision?
questions.explanation: Eagles can see 8 times better than humans! They can spot a rabbit from 2 miles away and see in almost perfect detail.

questions.question: What's the most recycled material on Earth?
questions.explanation: Steel is the most recycled material on Earth! It can be recycled infinitely without losing its properties, and 90% of it gets recycled.

questions.question: How many years does it take for plastic to decompose?
questions.explanation: Plastic takes 500-1000+ years to decompose! Some plastics may never fully break down, which is why recycling and reducing plastic use is so important.

questions.question: What animal has no vocal cords but can still 'talk'?
questions.explanation: Elephants can 'talk' without vocal cords! They communicate through infrasound - low-frequency rumbles that can travel for miles underground.

questions.question: How much stronger does adrenaline make you temporarily?
questions.explanation: Adrenaline can make you 2-3 times stronger temporarily! This 'hysterical strength' lets people lift cars to save lives in emergencies.

questions.question: What's the largest living thing on Earth?
questions.explanation: A honey fungus in Oregon is the largest living thing - covering 2,400 acres! It's basically one giant underground organism that's been growing for thousands of years.

questions.question: How many times per second does a hummingbird's wings beat?
questions.explanation: Hummingbird wings beat up to 80 times per second! That's why they make that humming sound and why their wings look invisible when flying.

questions.question: What happens to astronauts' height in space?
questions.explanation: Astronauts grow about 2 inches taller in space! Without gravity compressing their spine, the discs between vertebrae expand.

questions.question: How many times does the average person walk around the Earth in their lifetime?
questions.explanation: The average person walks enough in their lifetime to circle the Earth 5 times! That's about 110,000 miles of walking.

questions.question: What animal can sleep for 3 years straight?
questions.explanation: Some snails can sleep for up to 3 years! They hibernate in their shells during extreme weather conditions until it's safe to come out.

questions.question: How much energy does your brain use compared to your body?
questions.explanation: Your brain uses 20% of your body's total energy! Despite being only 2% of your body weight, it's incredibly energy-hungry.

questions.question: What's the only metal that's liquid at room temperature?
questions.explanation: Mercury is the only metal that's liquid at room temperature! It freezes at -38°F and has been used in thermometers for centuries.

questions.question: How many flowers must a bee visit to make one pound of honey?
questions.explanation: Bees must visit about 2 million flowers to make one pound of honey! A single bee only makes about 1/12th of a teaspoon in her entire lifetime.

questions.question: What happens to your brain when you're in love?
questions.explanation: Being in love activates the same brain regions as cocaine! Your brain releases dopamine, creating addiction-like feelings of euphoria and craving.

questions.question: How many Earths could fit inside a black hole the size of a marble?
questions.explanation: A black hole the size of a marble would have the mass of 3 Earths! The incredible density would create gravity so strong that nothing could escape.

questions.question: What existed on Earth before trees?
questions.explanation: Sharks existed before trees.

questions.question: What food never spoils, even after thousands of years?
questions.explanation: Honey never spoils.

questions.question: Botanically speaking, what are bananas classified as?
questions.explanation: Bananas are berries.
